import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Delete workflow"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"delete"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/workflows/{workflowId}"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Deletes a workflow. This is a destructive operation that cannot be undone.

**Note**: This endpoint is part of API version 1.0 which is marked as deprecated.

**Warning**: Deleting a workflow may affect existing tickets that reference it. Ensure no tickets are using this workflow before deletion.

**Authentication**: Requires authenticated user with workflow management permissions.

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

  parameters={[{"name":"workflowId","in":"path","required":true,"description":"UUID of the workflow to retrieve, update, or delete. Obtain by calling GET /api/v1.0/workflows.","schema":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"},"example":"11111111-2222-3333-4444-555555555555"}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
